text: The 1999–2000 Sporting de Gijón season was the second consecutive season of the club in Segunda División after its last relegation from La Liga. ==Overview== After the 33rd round, Pedro Braojos was sacked and Ciriaco Cano, former player of the club, replaced him at the helm of the first squad. == Squad == === From the youth squad === ==Competitions== ===La Liga=== ==== Results by round ==== ====League table==== ====Matches==== ===Copa del Rey=== ====Matches==== ==Squad statistics== ===Appearances and goals=== |} ==References== ==External links== *Profile at BDFutbol *Official website Category:Sporting de Gijón seasons Sporting de Gijon
title: 1999–2000 Sporting de Gijón season
